sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>gladiator</radical> in front of you draws his <radical>sword</radical>. He points the sword at your chest and right when you think everything is about to end, you realize he's pointing the sword at the <kanji>ticket</kanji> in your hand.
meaningInfo: Right! You needed to buy a ticket to see the gladiator! He doesn't want to kill you, he wants to check to make sure you bought a ticket.
readingMnemonic: The gladiator happily marks your <kanji>ticket</kanji> with his blade, when <reading>Ken</reading> (<ja>けん</ja>) the samurai pushes past you. He holds up his own sword, challenging the gladiator, who just shakes his head and points at your ticket again.
readingInfo: Ken takes a long time to examine your ticket. I don't think he understands that he needs a ticket to fight the gladiator. Maybe you should give him yours.
